name: Monk
description: Whether self-trained or taught in temples, monks find their footing with a distinct desire to maintain a sense of order and balance across the world, though one monk's methods may differ ideology from one another, they are all progressing towards one goal: Stability.

body.name: Perfect Self (Altered)
body.body: Starting at 20th level, you become innately charged with ki. You no longer need to expend ki to use your monk abilities, and when you finish a short or long rest, you gain temporary hitpoints equal to the number of points shown on the Ki Points column of the Monk table.

sections.name: The Elements Discipline
sections.body: You follow a monastic tradition that teaches you to attune to and harness the power of the elements. When you channel your ki, you align yourself with the forces of creation and bend the four natural elements to your will, using them as an extension of your body.

sections.name: Elemental Ki
sections.body: When you select this tradition at 3rd level, you learn how to expand your ki that enables you to bend the natural world around you. You gain a second ki pool, named Elemental Ki, that has the same number of points as your natural ki pool. You can only use Elemental Ki to power the abilities from this monastic tradition. Your Elemental Ki is refilled at the end of a short or long rest as you take the time to re-align yourself with the world.

sections.name: Elemental Bending
sections.body:
Starting at 3rd level, you unlock an array of powers that you can summon forth using your Elemental Ki. Choose two abilities from the Elemental Bending table to learn that you meet the requirements for. You become able to expend Elemental Ki to use these abilities. In addition, at every odd Monk level, you gain another power from the same table.

Each time you finish a long rest, you may re-attune to the elements and swap one Elemental Bending power in exchange for another that you meet the requirements for.

Whenever an Elemental Bending power asks for a saving throw, you use your usual Ki Save DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier). Whenever an Elemental Bending power asks for an attack roll, you can use either Dexterity or Strength for the attack bonus.

sections.name: Elemental Disposition
sections.body: While all monks of the elements can channel all four elements, at the very beginning, they were taught how each individual is predispositioned to a particular element. At 3rd level, choose between fire, water, air, or earth. Whenever you channel Elemental Bending, if the ability has that disposition, it costs 1 less Elemental Ki point for you to use.

sections.name: Magical Attunement
sections.body: Starting at 6th level, any damage from your Elemental Bending powers count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances and immunities to nonmagical damage.

sections.name: Greater Disposition
sections.body: Starting at 11th level, you become so attuned to the elements that they begin to innately protect you. You gain immunity to one damage type, as determined by your elemental disposition. Fire immunity for fire disposition, Piercing immunity for water disposition, Slashing immunity for air disposition, and Bludgeoning immunity for earth disposition.

sections.name: True Attunement
sections.body: Upon reaching 17th level, you have attuned so well to the elements that you have gained the knowledge of how to hit the key spots on a creature's body. As a bonus action, choose one creature within 60 feet. The targeted creature gains vulnerability to any damage dealt by Elemental Bending powers that share your disposition until the end of your next turn. You may use this feature a number of times per day equal to your Wisdom modifier, and regain all spent uses at the end of a long rest.

additionalContent.name: Elemental Bending
items: As an action, you spend 2 Elemental Ki points to summon a flaming chakram around your hands. Whenever you hit with your unarmed strikes, you deal Fire damage instead of Bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be set on fire for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier, taking your Martial Arts die in Fire damage at the start of each of their turn.

As a bonus action, you may choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet and spend 2 Elemental Ki points to summon water into your hands to mend their wounds. The creature regains hitpoints equal to your Martial Arts die plus your Wisdom modifier.

As a bonus action, you channel air around your feet by spending 2 Elemental Ki points. For a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier, you gain a fly speed equal to your Unarmored Movement speed. If you are still in the air at the end of your turn, you fall to the ground.

Starting at 11th level, you can stay in the air even after the end of your turn.

As a reaction, you may expend 2 Elemental Ki points to raise stone from the ground and shield yourself or an ally within 15 feet that you can see from an attack. The triggering attack gains disadvantage against its original target, and then the stone crumbles to dust.

Spending 3 Elemental Ki points as an action, you can cover yourself and up to 7 allies within 30 feet in a protective coating of fire for a number of hours equal to your Wisdom modifier. Each creature affected becomes immune to the effects of extreme cold, gains resistance to Cold damage, and any melee attacks that strike them causes the attacker to take 1d4 Fire damage.

As an action, you can spend 3 Elemental Ki points to summon forth a stream of water from your hands that you can manipulate. This remains for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier, and extends your reach for unarmed strikes and touch-based Elemental Bending powers by 10 feet.
Whenever you hit with your unarmed strikes, you may use a bonus action to spend 3 Elemental Ki and push the creature up to 30 feet away from you.

As an action, you can spend 3 Elemental Ki points in order to crumble and shake the earth underneath enemies near you. Each enemy within 15 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone and pushed 10 feet either away or towards you, your choice for each creature affected.

Summoning the forces of the elements, you can call forth a Fire Snake as an action by spending 4 Elemental Ki points. It appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet and lasts for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hitpoints, at which point it disappears. The Fire Snake follows your verbal commands and acts on its own turn in initiative.

Spending an action and using 4 Elemental Ki points, you create a special link between yourself and up to 3 other creatures within 30 feet that you can see using droplets of water across the ground. While in combat, at the start of each of your turns, creatures connected to you in this way regain your Martial Arts die in hitpoints. If a creature moves beyond 30 feet from you, this connection ends for that creature but remains for yourself and all others. Otherwise, this connection is maintained for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Spending 4 Elemental Ki points as an action, you can warp the air around you to make it harder for ranged attacks to strike you and your allies. Whenever an enemy that you can see tries to shoot through any area that is within 15 feet of you, they gain disadvantage on the attack.

Spending 4 Elemental Ki points, as an action you can sculpt an exact replica of a creature you have seen before out of stone. It appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. While obvious in bright light that it is made of stone, creatures in dim light or darkness must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be convinced that it is the creature. Additionally, you may use this Earth Mannequin as a conduit for your Elemental Bending, treating it as the source of your powers.

The mannequin lasts for 1 minute, and can be moved up to 30 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns. Taking 10 or more damage destorys the mannequin early.

Spending 5 Elemental Ki points as a bonus action, you kick your feet and propulse yourself using a wave of fire. You can then land anywhere within 120 feet of you that you can see. Each creature within 5 feet of you when you do this and when you land must make a Dexterity saving throw or take your Martial Arts die in Fire damage, taking half as much on a successful saving throw.

You spend an action and 5 Elemental Ki points to create a large weapon made of ice. It counts as a monk weapon for you, deals your Martial Arts die in Cold damage, and lasts for 1 hour. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can throw the weapon and cause it to shatter. Choose a 10-foot radius sphere within 30 feet of you when throwing it. Each creature in the radius when it shatters takes three times your Martial Arts die in Piercing damage.

You can conjure a small tornado using an action and 5 Elemental Ki within 60 feet of you. The tornado acts as a 5-foot radius, 2-foot-high cylinder and can be moved up to 30 feet in a new direction as an action on each of your turns. Each creature that enters its area for the first time or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 Bludgeoning damage, only taking half as much damage on a successful save.
Spending 5 Elemental Ki and a bonus action, for 1 minute you gain a burrowing speed equal to your speed. While tunneling through the ground, you gain blindsense out to a range of 30 feet.

You channel your body's energy to create lightning that ripples through your body. Spending 6 Elemental Ki and an action, choose one creature that you can see within 120 feet and make a ranged attack roll. The creature takes 5 times your Martial Arts die in Lightning damage on a hit.

As an action, spend 6 Elemental Ki and choose one creature that you can see within 60 feet. For the next minute, the target must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or else you get to choose the action it takes. On its first successful save, this effect ends.

Projecting your spirit as an action and spending 6 Elemental Ki, you reach out to a creature you are familiar with. An invisible form that you can see and hear through appears at that creature's location for up to 10 minutes. You cannot communicate or manipulate anything through this form except for the creature you are projecting towards, who can hear and speak to you telepathically, but cannot see you. If the chosen creature is sleeping, you instead appear in their dreams, and they can speak with and see you as normal.

Choosing up to a 20-foot radius circle on the ground within 60 feet as an action and spending 6 Elemental Ki, you can melt the chosen area's surface. The surface becomes difficult terrain and stays manipulated in this way for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, each creature that starts its turn in this area or enters the area for the first time must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d8 Fire damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful saving throw. Creatures prone in the area take double damage.

As an action, you can spend 7 Elemental Ki to conjure a marble made of pure elemental fire spirits and then throw it at a creature that you can see within 60 feet. Make a ranged attack roll, and on a hit the target takes 3d10 Fire damage as it burrows into their body. Once on each of your turns for the next minute, you may use an action to channel your Elemental Ki within the marble and make a new attack roll against a new target within the same range.

You call forth spirits from the Elemental Plane of Water to create a river or lake. As an action and spending 7 Elemental Ki, choose up to a 300-foot, 15-foot wide line or 120-foot diameter area originating from you. At the start of your next turn, the spirits finish transforming the land and the ground becomes water, sinking 30 feet deep. The transformation lasts for 10 minutes, and for the duration you gain a Swim speed equal to your speed.

You can conjure a heavy gust of air that creates cloud spirits to aid you. As an action, you spend 7 Elemental Ki and choose a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier that you can see. For 1 minute, at the start of each chosen target's turn, they must make a Constitution saving throw as these cloud spirits wrap themselves around each creature's head and begin mimicking disorienting lightning strikes. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d10 Thunder damage and cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn. A successful save ends this effect early for that creature.

You call forth gigantic earth spirits that can devastate structures in your path. Using an action and spending 7 Elemental Ki, for the next minute, you may command these Huge elemental spirits to strike at a structure within 300 feet that you can see. They use your proficiency bonus and Wisdom modifier for the attack roll, and deal 4d10 Bludgeoning damage on a successful strike. They will not target creatures, but may cause the structure to break in a way that will harm those in the way.

You find balance with the elements through the nature of your fire. As an action, you spend 8 Elemental Ki to do a beautiful dance that lashes out each of the elements out in a circle around you. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 6d10 Bludgeoning damage and 2d10 Fire damage as they are struck by a wave of fire that carries along the essences of the other elements.

Each of your limbs become transformed to act as a focus point for each of the elements, projecting their power through your fingertips and toes. As an action, you may spend 8 Elemental Ki to become infused with the four elements. For the next minute, once per round when you deal damage with your unarmed strikes, you can force a creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they suffer one of the following effects of your choice:
• Fire: You burn the target's body ashen grey. Until this Elemental Bending power ends, the target has disadvantage on Dexterity and Strength saving throws. At the end of each of their turns, the creature may make a new Constitution saving throw, and a successful save ends this effect early.
• Water: You sap the life force from their body and transfer it. At the start of each of their turns until this Elemental Bending power ends, the target must make a new Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d10 Necrotic damage, and you choose one creature within 30 feet of the target to restore a number of hitpoints equal to the damage dealt. A successful save ends this effect early.
• Air: You knock the target up to 30 feet into the air and use the air beneath them to keep them there until this Elemental Bending power ends. At the start of each of their turns, the target may make a new Constitution saving throw to end this effect early.
• Earth: You entrap the target in manacles of stone, making them Restrained until this Elemental Bending power ends. At the end of each of the creature's turns, they may make a new Constitution saving throw to end this effect early.

Connecting to the air around you, you learn to channel the other elements through each other to achieve balance amongst them. Spending an action and 8 Elemental Ki, your Elemental Bending powers and unarmed strikes gain a range of 120 feet for 1 minute.

Cycling through the elements, you can find a solid footing to connect to the other elements in true harmony with each other. Spending 8 Elemental Ki as an action, you gain blindsense out to a radius of 60 feet for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier. While this persists, you can use unarmed strikes and touch-based Elemental Bending powers on any creature in the same radius as long as they are touching the ground, as you channel the elements under your feet and have the earth deliver your strikes for you.

You unlock a key point mind that allows you to interact with the other planes. As an action, you can spend 9 Elemental Ki to summon a great monster from the Elemental Plane of Fire. Exploding forth and appearing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you appears an Fire Elemental Myrmidon. It stays and fights with you for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hitpoints, at which point it vanishes back to its home plane. It acts on its own initiative and follows your verbal commands, knowing you represent the bridge between the elemental worlds and the prime material.

You unlock a key point mind that allows you to interact with the other planes. As an action, you can spend 9 Elemental Ki to summon a great monster from the Elemental Plane of Water. Exploding forth and appearing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you appears an Water Elemental Myrmidon. It stays and fights with you for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hitpoints, at which point it vanishes back to its home plane. It acts on its own initiative and follows your verbal commands, knowing you represent the bridge between the elemental worlds and the prime material.

You unlock a key point mind that allows you to interact with the other planes. As an action, you can spend 9 Elemental Ki to summon a great monster from the Elemental Plane of Air. Exploding forth and appearing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you appears an Air Elemental Myrmidon. It stays and fights with you for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hitpoints, at which point it vanishes back to its home plane. It acts on its own initiative and follows your verbal commands, knowing you represent the bridge between the elemental worlds and the prime material.

You unlock a key point mind that allows you to interact with the other planes. As an action, you can spend 9 Elemental Ki to summon a great monster from the Elemental Plane of Earth. Exploding forth and appearing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you appears an Earth Elemental Myrmidon. It stays and fights with you for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hitpoints, at which point it vanishes back to its home plane. It acts on its own initiative and follows your verbal commands, knowing you represent the bridge between the elemental worlds and the prime material.

As an action, you spend 10 Elemental Ki points to enwrap yourself in a deadly and beautiful firestorm that takes on the form of a dragon. For 1 minute, your size becomes huge, and you gain a breath weapon attack that can be used to melt creatures in your path. Once on each round after your transformation, as an action you can target a 120-foot line. Each creature in its path must make a Constitution saving throw or take 10d10 Fire damage. Creatures that succeed take half as much damage.

Expending 10 Elemental Ki as an action, for 1 minute you manipulate a great amount of water around yourself to represent the form of a mighty Kraken. Your size becomes huge, you gain temporary hitpoints equal to twice your Monk level, and your reach with unarmed strikes becomes 20 feet with your newfound tentacles that sprout from you. Each time you hit with your unarmed strikes, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be grappled. You cannot grapple more than 3 creatures at once in this way.

Spending 10 Elemental Ki points, you reach for total enlightenment, becoming one with the air around you. For 1 minute, you disappear, become untargetable, and able to manipulate the wind in ways never thought before. As an action on each turn after transforming, you can choose to either begin or stop a windstorm. Each time you start the storm, you can choose any number of the following effects for it to have:
• At the end of each of your turns, creatures that you choose within 120 feet of where you were must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take your Martial Arts die in Bludgeoning damage, taking half on a successful save, as strikes of wind lash out across the area.
• Ranged attacks that you choose have disadvantage against their targets, as sweeping gusts of air attempt to thrash in front of their pathways.
• Allied creatures gain a bonus to their movement speed equal to your Unarmored Movement speed as air wraps around their limbs and surges them forward.

Expending 10 Elemental Ki as an action, for 1 minute you take on a monsterous form of a giant construct made of stone. Your size becomes huge, you gain additional AC equal to your Wisdom modifier, and the ability to throw chunks of your stone form. These count as a thrown weapon attack that have a range of 60 feet, and deal 4d10 Bludgeoning damage on a hit. Creatures that are hit must also make a Constitution saving throw, falling prone on a failed save.
